question: A 50-year-old female arrives in the emergency department with complaints of shortness of breath, chest pain, and sweating. The doctor is going to examine her cardiovascular system in detail. On examination, the left parasternal line in the fourth intercostal space on the precordium corresponds to which area?
The area of supply of the left coronary artery is the:

answers.option: Right ventricle adjoining anterior interventricular groove
Left ventricle adjoining posterior interventricular groove

question: Which of the following is true regarding the superior vena cava?

answers.option: Drains into the right atrium of the heart
It is formed by the union of external and internal jugular veins
Lies entirely in the superior mediastinum
It drains blood from all the structures above the diaphragm except the lungs
Begins at the level of the second right coastal cartilage

question: The coronary sinus opens into what structure?
Students were examining the interior of the right atrium in a cadaver and found a smooth interior wall. They were told that this area was formed by the right sinus horn. What is this area called?
The base of the heart is formed by:
Regarding the left coronary artery, which of the following is correct?

answers.option: Supplies the atrioventricular node in 80% of humans
Runs between the pulmonary trunk and left auricle
Has no anastomosis with the right coronary artery
Arises from the anterior aortic sinus

question: The structure that hooks around the ligamentum arteriosum is:
Vasa vasorum are predominantly found in large blood vessels, large arteries, and large veins. What are the vasa vasorum?

answers.option: Nerves that supply the blood vessels
Blood vessels within the walls of blood vessels

question: Which of these is the structure that accompanies the aorta through the aortic hiatus?
Which of the following does not open into the right atrium?
Which of the following is correct for echocardiography?

answers.option: Provides information about both structural and physiological deformities

question: A first-year resident is studying the valvular outlet of the ventricle and is positioned at the infundibulum. This is present at which valve?
Which valve guides the blood in the right to left shunt of foramen ovale?
Regarding the brachiocephalic veins, which of the following is correct?

answers.option: Present on either side at the root of the neck
Formed by the union of internal jugular vein and subclavian vein

question: Which of the following is the correct comparison between the tricuspid and semilunar valves?

answers.option: Aortic valve closure cause first heart sound
Chordae tendinae attach to semilunar valves
Chordae tendineae of both are attached to papillary muscles
Mitral valve closure cause second heart sound

question: Which of the following veins does not have valves?
The left ventricle directly receives impulses from which of the following?
Which of the following veins drain the body wall of the embryo?
The shunt found in interatrial septal defect due to which of the following?
Regarding the right coronary artery, which of the following is incorrect?

answers.option: Arises from the right aortic sinus
Supplies the posteroinferior two-thirds of interventricular septum
Mostly the right coronary artery is dominant

question: Regarding the left coronary artery, which of the following is incorrect?

answers.option: Has anastomosis with the right coronary artery
Arises from the anterior aortic sinus
Runs between the pulmonary trunk and left auricle
Supplies the atrioventricular node in some exceptional cases

question: Regarding the coronary arteries, which of the following statements is correct?

answers.option: The left coronary artery arises from the left posterior aortic sinus
The left coronary artery supplies the posterior part of interventricular septum
The left coronary artery arises from the right posterior aortic sinus
The right coronary artery supplies the anterior part of interventricular septum
The left coronary artery does not supply the interventricular septum

question: The blood moves out of left ventricle by passing through which of the following?
Pick the odd one out regarding lymphatic capillaries.

answers.option: Remove excess fluid from interstitial space
Have a single layer of endothelium

question: Occlusion of which of the following arteries is most likely to cause cerebral ischemia?
Which of these statements about the mitral valve is incorrect?

answers.option: It separates the left atrium from the left ventricle
It is audible over the apical region of the heart
Reversal of blood flow occurs around its posterior cusp
It lies behind the left half of the sternum at the fourth costal cartilage
Its anterior cusp is larger than the posterior cusp

question: While treating patent ductus arteriosus, there is a possibility of damage to which of the following nerves?
Occlusion in coronary artery disease occurs most commonly in which artery?

answers.option: Left circumflex branch of left coronary artery

question: What does the left coronary artery supply?

answers.option: Complete right artrium and some part of left ventricle
Posteroinferior third of the interventricular septum
Small part of right side of anterior interventricular groove
Most of left atrium, left ventricle, and interventricular septum

question: What is true about the coronary arteries?

answers.option: Arise in the posterior part of aorta
Forms anastomoses only at the apex
Nodal branch in most of the people is from left coronary artery

question: Which of the following is true regarding the pulmonary trunk?

answers.option: Arise anterior to root of aorta
Lies posterior to the arch of aorta
Bifurcates posterior to the arch of aorta

question: Which of the following is correct regarding the heart?

answers.option: The right ventricle forms the apex
Opening of superior vena cava is larger than inferior vena cava
Opening of inferior vena cava is smaller than superior vena cava
The left ventricle forms the base
Superior vena cava opens on the posterior side of right atrium.

question: What are the thebesian valves the valve of?

Which of the following structures related to the right atrium is inappropriate?
What is incorrect regarding anatomical end arteries?

answers.option: They occur where no anastamosis exists
They supply specific tissue of an organ
Their damage leads to necrosis of supplied tissue
They supply the kidneys, brain, and retina
They are the same as functional end arteries

question: During a class discussion, the teacher asked about the tributaries opening in the right atrium. Which of the following does not open in the right atrium?

Superficial to the epicardium at the junction of superior and inferior vena cava
Postero-inferior region of the inter atrial septum
Posterolaterally at the junction of inferior vena cava and right atrium

question: The right coronary artery arises from which of the following sinuses?

answers.option: From anterior and posterior aortic sinuses

question: Which one of the following separates the atria from the ventricles?
Which of the following structures present in the superior mediastinum is not enclosed by the pericardium?

answers.option: Initial part of inferior vena cava
Upper half of superior vena cava

question: To what structure is fibrous pericardium attached?

answers.option: Is not attached to any part of the heart

question: What is not true about the superior vena cava?

answers.option: Formed by right and left brachiocephalic veins
Begins at the first costal cartilage
Is not separated from right atrium via any valves

question: Which of the following is true regarding the blood supply of the atrioventricular node?

answers.option: From right coronary artery in 50% of the population
From left coronary artery in 80% of the population
From right coronary artery in 20% of the population
From left coronary artery in 60% of the population
From right coronary artery in 80% of the population

answers.option: It arises from the lateral aortic sinus
It emerges at the surface of the heart between the root of the pulmonary trunk and the right auricle
It gives nodal artery in 40% of the cases
It is larger than the left coronary artery
It ends by anastomosing with the right marginal artery

question: What is true about pericardium?

answers.option: Fibrous pericardium is adherent to visceral layer of serous pericardium
It is attached to the sternum by anterior and posterior sternopericardial ligaments
Serous pericardium is a double-layered structure lined by mesothelium
Fibrous pericardium is continuous with serous pericardium
